Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterParts of a Plant5
Ther e are different plan ts around us. All plan ts have two main parts: one 
belo w the ground and the other above the ground.
The part of the plan t that grows belo w the ground it called the root system. 
The part of the plan t that grows above the ground is called the shoot system. 
The shoot system consis ts of stem, leaves, flowers and fruits.! Look a t the pictur e and label dif ferent parts of a plan t.
! Which part of the plan t grows belo w the soil?
Environmental Studies-439
Unit–II : The Living World

Tap roots–  A tap root is a thick, single root 
that does not have any branches.
Pea, Radish, turnip, carrot are examples 
of plan ts having tap root etc.
Fibrous roots–  A fibrous root grows from the base 
of the stem and has man y branches. All types of 
grasses, whea t and rice have fibrous roots.
Special T ypes of R oots
Besides the basic functions performed by them, there are some roots that perform 
special functions.
Water storing roots–  Roots of some plan ts like pumpkin and gourd store water for 
the plan t to survive long during the dry summer mon ths.
Food storing roots–  Some roots store extra food in them. Such roots are used in 
our kitchens and are an import ant part of our food. Carrot, radish, beetroot, turnip, 
sweet-potato etc. are their examples.
Carrot Radish TurnipRoots of Plants
The roots fix the plan t in the soil. They absorb water and miner als from the soil. 
Ther e are two main types of roots: tap roots and fibrous roots.
Environmental Studies-4 40

The Shoot System
The shoot system includes all those parts of a 
plan t that grow above the ground. A shoot 
system has– stem, leaves, flowers and fruits.
Stem– It carries water, miner als and food 
prepar ed by the leaves to all parts of the 
plan t. The stem bear s leaves, buds, flowers 
and fruits.
Leaves– The leaves are mostly green in 
colour . They mak e food for the plan t and 
therefore, called the kitchen of the plan t. We 
eat leave of man y plan t such as spinach, 
lettuce, cabbag e etc.
Green leafy vegetables are good for health. Leaves of some plan ts e.g. neem, tulsi, 
eucalyptus etc. are used in medicines.Stem
Leaves
Flow ers– Flowers are the mos t beautiful 
part of a plan t and have different shapes, 
sizes, colour s and smells. Flowers grow 
into fruits.
Different flowersProp roots–  Some trees like the banyan tree 
have roots that grow from the branches and 
reach the ground. Sometimes, they get 
attached to the soil and provide additional 
support to the plan t.
Such roots that grow from the branches above 
the ground, are called prop roots or aerial 
roots. Ficus and peepal tree also grow aerial 
roots as their age increases.
Banyan tree
Environmental Studies-441

You  Know Must 
Marigold flowers k eep mosquitoes and flies awa y.Flowers in Our Lives
Flowers bring colour s and freshness to our surroundings and homes. We use 
flowers in a number of ways.
1. To offer prayers— In places of worship we use fresh flowers for decoration 
and to offer prayers.
2. As food— We eat flowers of cauliflo wer, broccoli, banana and pumpkin as 
vegetables. Rose water and rose petals are used to flavour sweets.
3. For making perfumes—  Some flowers are used for making perfumes, soap s 
and shampoos.
4. For greeting–  We greet people with a bouque t of flowers to express our 
emotions on special days.
5. For making dy es and c olour s– Petals of some flo wers are used t o mak e dry 
colour s called gulal during Holi celebr ation. Man y dyes are also prepar ed 
with them.
 Besides man y other uses, women adorn themselv es by wearing flowers in 
their hair.
Plan ts are a lovely gift of nature. Human beings or animals cannot live without 
plan ts. We mus t look after plan ts and protect forest.Fruits– A fruit is the sweet and flesh y product that has seeds inside.
The seeds produce new plan ts.
Flower growing into fruitFlower
Fruit Fruit
having seeds
(Knowledge )

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterFood and HealthUnit–III : Our Needs
6
Good health means the state of over all well-being of a person. We cannot buy 
good heath from anywher e. It is to be main tained by taking care of certain 
things. The key to good health lies in our daily activities. One of them is eating 
health y food.Look at the given pictur e. Roma is enjo ying jalebis from a street vendor .
! Is it a health y practice?
! Should w e eat unc overed street food?
Healthy Food
We should eat foods that provide us ener gy and help in growth of our body . Junk 
food and cold, sugary drink s are not good for health.
We mus t follow good eating habits, too, to main tain good health. Some of them 
are–
! Wash hands before and after the meals.
! Add fruits and salad in your diet.
Environmental Studies-447

You  Know Must ! Eat properly cooked food.
! Keep all the food items covered.
! Use clean water and clean utensils.
Food contains different useful substances called nutrien ts, which are needed by 
our body for various purposes.
The main nutrien ts needed by our body are–
! Carboh ydrates    Fats
! Proteins     Vitamins & Miner als
Besides, food also contains roughag e and water which are essen tial for proper 
functioning of our body .
Carboh ydrates– Carboh ydrates provide ener gy to the body . The rich sour ces of 
carboh ydrates are: bread, cereals, potato, sugar, hone y, jam etc.Eating health y food fills your body with ener gy.
Fats– Fats are a richer sour ce of ener gy than carboh ydrates. Excess carboh ydrates 
are converted into fats and stored in the body . Fats and carboh ydrates together are 
known as ener gy-giving foods . Rich sour ces of fats are:  butter, ghee, oil, nuts, dry-
fruits, mea t etc.
bread, cereals, potato, sugar, honey, jam(Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-4 48

Proteins– Proteins are needed for growth. They also repair the damag ed cells. So, 
they are called body -building food. Milk, eggs, pulses, cheese, fish, mea t etc. are 
some good sour ces of proteins.
Vitamins and Miner als– Vitamins and miner als protect our body from various 
diseases and keep us health y and strong. This is the reason, they are called the 
protectiv e foods. Vitamins help us to have a good vision health y gums, and a 
glowing skin. Ther e are different kinds of vitamins. These are: Vitamin A, Vitamin B, 
Vitamin C, Vitamin D, Vitamin E. and Vitamin K. Fresh fruits, vegetables, mea t, fish , 
milk and eggs are rich in vitamins.
Miner als help in the f orma tion of blood, bones and t eeth. Main miner als needed 
by our body are: calcium, iron, sodium and potassium. Calcium is needed for 
health y teeth and strong bones. Iron help s in the forma tion of blood.
Green leafy vegetables, fruits, milk, fish etc. are good sour ces of miner als.
Roughage– Roughage is the fibrous material present in cereals, fruits and 
vegetables. It is requir ed for proper functioning of the digestive system. It help s in 
the remo val of waste material from the large intestine and prevents constipation.
Environmental Studies-449

You  Know Must Water– Besides nutrien ts and roughag e, our body also needs sufficien t amoun t of 
water to stay health y. Water help s us:
! in digestion of food.
! to remo ve wastes (in the form of urine and sweat) from the body .
! to main tain our body temper ature.
We mus t drink at least 8-10 glasses of water everyday.
Almost two- third of our body weigh t consists o f wat er.
Balanced Diet– A diet which contains all the 
nutrien ts, roughag e and w ater in the righ t amoun t 
is called a balanced diet.
We mus t eat balanced diet for proper functioning of 
our body .
Diseases
Disease is defined as the condition in which our body does not function properly . 
Diseases are of two types–
Communic able diseases–  These diseases are caused by germs or micr obes. They 
can spread through contamina ted food, water, air, insect bites or contact with 
infected persons. Examples of such type of diseases are–
Common cold, tuber culosis, measles, typhoid, dengue, choler a, Covid-19 etc.
To prevent such diseases, the best method is to main tain proper hygiene of body , 
food, water and surroundings.
Non-Communic able or de ficiency diseases–  Non c ommunic able diseases do not 
spread from one person to another . They may occur due to deficiency of one or 
more nutrien ts in our body . So, they are also called deficiency diseases. Examples 
are– anaemia, rickets, goitre etc.(Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-4 50

! Obesity–  Excessiv e intake of carboh ydrates and fats 
which causes excessiv e body weigh t.Diseases due to faulty life style
! Malnutrition–  It is also called under -nutrition. It is the 
result of not having enough food or enough of the 
right kind of food
Hygiene is necessar y to stay health y and keep away diseases. It is defined as the 
science of cleanliness which help s ensur e good health. The following are some of 
the steps for main taining proper hygiene:
! Take bath daily . It remo ves dust and sweat presen t on our body .
! Wash your hands after using the toilets. If we do not wash our hands properly , 
germs and dirt enter our body .
! Keep your surroundings clean. Do not throw garbag e in open. The garbag e in 
open attracts flies and mosquit oes.
! Let fresh air and sunligh t enter into the house. Sunligh t kills germs.Hygiene
! Nutrien ts – Substances which are useful for the body .
! Deficiency – Short age of a substance in our body .
! Roughag e – Fibrous material in our food.
! Hygiene – cleanliness.
Key termsKey termsKey terms

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterFrom Farm to Our PlateUnit–III : Our Needs
7
We all need food for our survival. It gives us ener gy to do work. But have we 
ever though t wher e does all this food come from? The foods we eat travel a 
long journe y before they reach our plates. They are produced in the (farms) 
by the farmer s.! Put a tick (3) belo w the health y food items and cross (7) for the 
unhealth y ones.
! Wher e does this food come from?Look at the pictures of food items given below.
The mass production of plan ts for food and other purposes is called agricultur e or 
farming.
The various steps of farming are–
1. Ploughing–  Farmer s prepar e the soil by loosening it through a special process 
known as ploughing. The ploughs may be attached to the bullock carts or the 
tractors.The Farmers at the Farms
Environmental Studies-455

2. Manuring–  After ploughing , the farmer s add manur e and fertiliz ers to the soil to 
provide nutrien ts to the soil. This increases the productivity of the soil.
3. Levelling–  After manuring , the soil is levelled to mak e the surface even.
4. Sowing Seeds– Health y seeds are sown in the soil after levelling. Seeds can be 
sown manually or with the help of machines. These seeds grow into saplings 
afer getting right amoun t of warmth, water and air.
The pack ed crops are transport ed to the wholesale mark et commonly called mandi 
for selling. Carts, truck s, tractors etc. are used to transport the food crops to 
mark et. 
Shopk eeper s and vendor s from towns or cities come to the mandi and buy the 
products in bulk. They then, sell them in their shop s at a higher rate to mak e profit. From Farm to Mandi6. Spraying pesticides–  When the crops grow, farmer s spray insecticides and 
pesticides to protect the crop from insects and pests like rats, termit es etc. Scare 
crows are kept in the crop field to scare away birds.
7. Harvesting–  When the crops are ripe, they are cut and gathered. This process is 
called harvesting. Harvesting is done by sickles or machines called harvesters. 
The farmer s then separ ate the ripened seeds from the plan ts. This is called 
threshing. Then they remo ve the husk from the grains. This is called winno wing.
 The harvested crops need to be stored properly in granaries to protect them 
from roden ts like rats, squirr els etc. Vegetables and fruits get spoilt fast, so they 
have to be sold quickly .5. Irrigation– After the seeds are sown, the 
fields need to be watered regularly . This is 
called irrigation. The various means of 
irrigation are— wells, tube-w ells, canals.
Environmental Studies-4 56

A large number of people work hard in making food available to us. We should be 
thankful to all of them. We should not waste food. We should always remember 
that there are man y people who do not get enough food to eat. Some ways by 
which we can prevent the wastage of food are–
! Buy food items in the requir ed quan tities only.
! Avoid unnecessar y cooking.
! Keep the leftover food in the refrigerator.
! Try to reuse the leftover food by making new recipes.
! Main tain the correct temper ature in refrigerator to keep the food fresh for a 
long er duration of time.
! Always take as much food in your plate that you can finish easily .Avoid Food W astageThe small shopk eeper s who buy the products from wholesaler s for selling in their 
shop s are called retailer s or grocer s. We (the consumer s) buy these products from 
! Agricultur e – growing crops on a large scale
! Ploughing – loosening the soil
! Manuring – Adding manur es and fertiliz ers
! Irrigation – Watering the plan ts
! Harvesting – Process of cutting and collectingKey termsKey termsKey terms
